definition: a field on which the buildings of a university are situated
note: Campus is the key concept here

definition: a living thing that has (or can develop) the ability to act or function independently
note: Better match for 'organic thing' than fertilizer

definition: any address at which you dwell more than temporarily
note: Use residence as base, temporary is modifier

definition: armament in the form of a device capable of launching a rocket
a large house trailer that can be connected to utilities and can be parked in one place and used as permanent housing
any nonverbal action or gesture that encodes a message
note: Signalling is the process, electrical is modifier

definition: a device or control that is very useful for a particular job
note: Appliance is key, major indicates size

definition: a military service responsible for the safety of maritime traffic in coastal waters
electromagnetic radiation of short wavelength produced when high-speed electrons strike a solid target
a process in which individuals (or small groups) penetrate an area (especially the military penetration of enemy positions without detection)
the steady flow of surface ocean water in a prevailing direction
note: Ocean current is broader, includes littoral currents

definition: a relatively large open container that you fill with water and use to wash the body
an occupation requiring special education (especially in the liberal arts or sciences)
note: Profession is key, entertainment is domain

definition: a very large tub (large enough for more than one bather) filled with hot water
note: Hot tub is synonym for whirlpool tub

definition: an abstraction belonging to or characteristic of an entity
plants having seeds in a closed ovary
an adult person who is male (as opposed to a woman)
an active and efficient cause; capable of producing a certain effect
warm-blooded egg-laying vertebrates characterized by feathers and forelimbs modified as wings
any living or extinct member of the family Hominidae characterized by superior intelligence, articulate speech, and erect carriage
an instrumentality invented for a particular purpose
any of various mostly cold-blooded aquatic vertebrates usually having scales and breathing through gills
